reviews.title: Adequate, but terrible for public transport
reviews.text: This hotel is in 1970s development of aparments and pedestrian walkways. The idea was "modern living" but it just looks tired and dated. Because of the walkways there are no pavements (Sidewalks) by the roads, so walking anywhere along the roads is very hard.
Public transport is zero and cabs very very very pricey. A cab to our office (exactly 10km by road) cost €35....
reviews.title: Not a business hotel, too much missing to recommend...

reviews.text: The hotel is modern in style. My room was big but cold and whatever I did to the heating did not help. Room and bathroom was very clean.
reviews.title: Not bad

reviews.text: Breakfast was fantastic for Italy. Dinner was fairly dire (and pricey) for Italy. Each dish had a descrption of 20-30 words when a simple pasta dish would have been lovely. I also ate at a Chinese in the complex and that was very bland
reviews.title: Hotel in a Peaceful setting

reviews.text: They do now have a "gym" although this is in fact a small room with two treadmills and one exercise bike.
reviews.title: Once more - perfect stay

reviews.text: The room was very modern, clean and spacious (upgraded to get the free internet, awesome room was a nice side effect.) Nice enough area, but not a whole lot to do. We were just staying here to be close to the airport for an early morning flight.
reviews.title: Beautiful, modern rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed here last week and I've never been to a hotel that could care less for the comfort of their guests. It started when I checked in (It was late and I was by myself). I broke my hand the week before so I had a cast. They decided to place us in the residence area so they called a guy to take me over. He looked to be a bellman but he walked up and then walked away with out saying one word. DIDNT offer to carry my bag which was not a rolling bag and raced across the stone LARGE DARK courtyard with not a single word. When I awoke and needed to iron my clothes I was told you had to go to an iron room, they do not provide irons. The gym was a joke and they don't provide towels although they have a sign for dirty towels. The woman at the front dest said I had to bring it from my room. well for the two of us they only give you two large towels and 2 towels that are more like a dish cloth for your hands. I could go on and on but all I can say, do NOT stay here. Maybe if youre italian they treat you better.
reviews.title: Horrible

reviews.text: This hotel was booked by my husband's company for a business trip since it was close to his office. First note - it's very expensive to get to by taxi from Malpensa airport; we spent approx 110 Euros (the train from Malpensa would have been the more economical option).
reviews.title: Fine if it's close to your office

reviews.text: The hotel was clean and comfortable, the room was a fair size and the bathroom was clean (our room had a shower stall rather than a bath). There was a hair dryer in the bathroom, but you needed to visit the laundry room to use their iron.
reviews.title: Not impressed and would choose somewhere else next time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was great - it was a buffet that consistently had breads, croissants, meats and cheeses, cereals, yoghurt, fresh fruit and a hot station with scrambled eggs, bacon and sausage. Dinner was bland and expensive; we preferred to walk across the complex to the cafeteria la Sorbetteria, which had tasty food and great staff (at least one who was fluent in English).
reviews.title: Avoid unless you want to be treated badly

reviews.text: Good hotel in the centre of a housing develoment that said it is functional and the staff attentive. Breakfast starts at 7.00 so early getaways mean no coffee however a reasonable selection of food us available. Make sure you have the taxi take you to NH at Milano 2 and not the NH in Segrate as that is a €30.00 mistake !!
reviews.title: Good hotel in the centre of a housing develoment

reviews.text: I stayed here on 2nd floor for 2 nights on business. I had been booked in by the company i was working for. I looked at the reviews on here and was highly concerned the two nights would be a nightmare. However when I got there the man in the reception made me very welcome. I cannot speak Italian and his English wasn't good but he went out of his way to help. The room was fine, I stay in loads of hotels and the room was average size, tv fine and bathroom good size. The decor is starting to suffer. Breakfast was good, and plenty of choice. Bar is very expensive. However nearby are restaurants, including a Chinese and coffee bar where prices are more reasonable. There is also free wifi in the lobby for 24 hours and it worked very well in my room too. Just need to ask for a login name and password. Also regarding staff the barman was very friendly and kept me topped up with a great variety of free snacks both hot and cold for as long as I was in there. Biggest negative in room was the heating is very noisy and had to turn it off during night and put extra blanket on bed. Bed was comfortable. I would stay there again. I can't comment on room price as was paid for.
reviews.title: Not as bad as I feared

reviews.title: Pack a mattress

reviews.text: I stayd at NH Milano 2 hotel for 3 nights for the purpose of a conference. The hotel is a rather typical business hotel, and rooms are as expected - a bit small, but neat & clean in all aspects. Breakfast choices are typical, but good quality. The entrance which starts with a staircase as soon as you step in (stairs must be climbed to reach reception) made me wonder about disabled access, didn't see how this was arranged. Building design is a bit strange, however cozy.
reviews.title: Not bad, a bit off the beaten track..

reviews.text: This hotel is situated in a suburb, literally at least 30 min drive from Milan centre, and apart from a generic chinese/sushi restaurant and a ice cream parlour around the corner and the hotel restaurant & bar (which are quite good, but quite & offer very limited selection) do not expect any bars, restaurants or such in the near vicinity - there are none. Without a car, the hotel can feel rather isolated. Taxi to downtown costs between 25 - 35 euros.
reviews.title: Attractive Property

reviews.text: The pond behind the hotel is quite scenic, but the hotel has no pool.
reviews.title: Just set the right expectation and rest will fall into it's places

reviews.text: Stayed one night. Pros: Beautiful setting in wooded, planned community. Bus stop is at front of property that connects to Metro line to city center. Spacious room, comfortable bed, fine breakfast. Staff was very helpful with public transportation to city center. Cons: Difficult to find using GPS. But I have now noted that the GPS coordinates on are the website. I recommend programming them into GPS device before trip.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: We can for a 3 days team meeting and this is my first trip here. I took a taxi from Milan Central Station and cost about Eur20.
reviews.title: Fine for a couple of nights
